results.title: The safety and tolerability of lisinopril in clinical trials.
results.text_hl: @DISEASE_Hypotension @DISEASE_MESH:D007022 @@@Hypotension@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Headache</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006261 @@@orthostatic effects@@@, or @DISEASE_Dizziness @DISEASE_MESH:D004244 @@@dizziness@@@ following the initial @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ dose occurred infrequently in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@.

results.title: Clinical experience with lisinopril. Observations on safety and tolerability.
results.text_hl: In the @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ population, the most frequent adverse events reported were @<m>DISEASE_Headache</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006261 @@@headache@@@, @DISEASE_Dizziness @DISEASE_MESH:D004244 @@@dizziness@@@, @DISEASE_Cough @DISEASE_MESH:D003371 @@@cough@@@, @DISEASE_Nausea @DISEASE_MESH:D009325 @@@nausea@@@, @DISEASE_Diarrhea @DISEASE_MESH:D003967 @@@diarrhoea@@@ and @DISEASE_Fatigue @DISEASE_MESH:D005221 @@@fatigue@@@, although not all of these events were thought to be related to @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@; 6.1% discontinued @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ due to adverse clinical events, most commonly @DISEASE_Cough @DISEASE_MESH:D003371 @@@cough@@@ and @DISEASE_Nausea @DISEASE_MESH:D009325 @@@nausea@@@.

citations.NLM: Cameron HA, Higgins TJ. Clinical experience with lisinopril. Observations on safety and tolerability. J Hum Hypertens. 1989 Jun;3 Suppl 1():177-86. PMID: 2550641
citations.BibTeX: @article{2550641, title={Clinical experience with lisinopril. Observations on safety and tolerability.}, author={Cameron HA and Higgins TJ}, journal={J Hum Hypertens}, volume={3 Suppl 1}, pages={177-86}}

results.title: Review of international safety data for lisinopril-hydrochlorothiazide combination treatment.
results.text_hl: In clinical trials, adverse experiences in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ treated with a @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@-@CHEMICAL_Hydrochlorothiazide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006852 @@@hydrochlorothiazide@@@ combination were @DISEASE_Dizziness @DISEASE_MESH:D004244 @@@dizziness@@@ (7.5%), @<m>DISEASE_Headache</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006261 @@@headache@@@ (5.2%), @DISEASE_Cough @DISEASE_MESH:D003371 @@@cough@@@ (3.9%), @DISEASE_Fatigue @DISEASE_MESH:D005221 @@@fatigue@@@ (3.7%), @<m>DISEASE_Headache</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006261 @@@orthostatic effects@@@ (3.2%), @DISEASE_Diarrhea @DISEASE_MESH:D003967 @@@diarrhoea@@@ (2.5%), @DISEASE_Nausea @DISEASE_MESH:D009325 @@@nausea@@@ (2.2%) and @DISEASE_Respiratory_Tract_Infections @DISEASE_MESH:D012141 @@@upper respiratory tract infection@@@ (2.2%).

citations.NLM: Murray NH. Review of international safety data for lisinopril-hydrochlorothiazide combination treatment. J Hum Hypertens. 1991 Dec;5 Suppl 2():63-7; discussion 68. PMID: 1665180
citations.BibTeX: @article{1665180, title={Review of international safety data for lisinopril-hydrochlorothiazide combination treatment.}, author={Murray NH}, journal={J Hum Hypertens}, volume={5 Suppl 2}, pages={63-7; discussion 68}}

results.title: Prophylactic treatment of migraine with angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitor (lisinopril): randomised, placebo controlled, crossover study.
results.text_hl: Thirty @SPECIES_9606 @@@participants@@@ followed this schedule, and 30 received placebo followed by @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@. MAIN OUTCOME MEASURES: Primary end points: number of hours with @<m>DISEASE_Headache</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006261 @@@headache@@@, number of days with @<m>DISEASE_Headache</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006261 @@@headache@@@, number of days with @DISEASE_Migraine_Disorders @DISEASE_MESH:D008881 @@@migraine@@@.

results.title: Syndrome of inappropriate antidiuretic hormone secretion associated with lisinopril.
results.text_hl: OBJECTIVE: To describe a case of the @DISEASE_Inappropriate_ADH_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D007177 @@@syndrome of inappropriate antidiuretic hormone secretion@@@ (@DISEASE_Inappropriate_ADH_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D007177 @@@SIADH@@@) associated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ therapy. CASE SUMMARY: A 76-year-old white @SPECIES_9606 @@@woman@@@ who was being treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Metoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008790 @@@metoprolol@@@ for @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ presented with @<m>DISEASE_Headache</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006261 @@@headaches@@@ accompanied by @DISEASE_Nausea @DISEASE_MESH:D009325 @@@nausea@@@ and a @DISEASE_Paresthesia @DISEASE_MESH:D010292 @@@tingling sensation@@@ in her arms.

citations.NLM: Shaikh ZH, Taylor HC, Maroo PV, Llerena LA. Syndrome of inappropriate antidiuretic hormone secretion associated with lisinopril. Ann Pharmacother. 2000 Feb;34(2):176-9. PMID: 10676825

results.title: Evaluation of antihypertensive efficacy of lisinopril compared to metoprolol in moderate to severe hypertension.
results.text_hl: These decreases in systolic blood pressures were maintained at week 8, again with statistical significance (p less than 0.01). Of the 118 @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@-treated @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@, four were discontinued from @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ therapy because of @<m>DISEASE_Headache</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006261 @@@headache@@@, @DISEASE_Dizziness @DISEASE_MESH:D004244 @@@dizziness@@@, @DISEASE_Exanthema @DISEASE_MESH:D005076 @@@rash@@@, @DISEASE_Flushing @DISEASE_MESH:D005483 @@@flushing@@@, or @DISEASE_Lymphatic_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D008206 @@@lymphadenopathy@@@.

results.title: Nisoldipine CC and lisinopril alone or in combination for treatment of mild to moderate systemic hypertension. Canadian Nisoldipine CC Hypertension Trial Group.
results.text_hl: Adverse effects were more frequent with nisoldipine CC (@<m>DISEASE_Headache</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006261 @@@headache@@@ and @DISEASE_Edema @DISEASE_MESH:D004487 @@@peripheral edema@@@) than with @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ (@DISEASE_Cough @DISEASE_MESH:D003371 @@@cough@@@) monotherapy.

citations.NLM: Ruddy TD, Fodor JG. Nisoldipine CC and lisinopril alone or in combination for treatment of mild to moderate systemic hypertension. Canadian Nisoldipine CC Hypertension Trial Group. Cardiovasc Drugs Ther. 1997 Sep;11(4):581-90. PMID: 9358963

results.title: Efficacy and tolerability of lisinopril compared with extended release felodipine in patients with essential hypertension. Danish Cooperative Study Group.
results.text_hl: On @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ treatment, reports of @<m>DISEASE_Headache</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006261 @@@headache@@@ and @DISEASE_Dizziness @DISEASE_MESH:D004244 @@@dizziness@@@ were reduced while that of @DISEASE_Cough @DISEASE_MESH:D003371 @@@cough@@@ increased.

citations.NLM: Jensen HA. Efficacy and tolerability of lisinopril compared with extended release felodipine in patients with essential hypertension. Danish Cooperative Study Group. Clin Exp Hypertens A. 1992;14(6):1095-110. PMID: 1330386
